event: Earliest human settlements in Chile, including Monte Verde
Inca Empire expands into northern Chile under Tupac Inca Yupanqui
First Spanish expedition led by Diego de Almagro reaches Chile
Pedro de Valdivia founds Santiago
Mapuche leader Lautaro defeats and kills Valdivia in Battle of Tucapel
First Government Junta forms in Santiago, start of independence movement
Chile formally declares independence from Spain
New constitution establishes conservative republic
War of the Pacific begins; Chile defeats Peru and Bolivia
Civil war leads to establishment of parliamentary republic
New constitution creates strong presidential system
Salvador Allende elected president, first Marxist elected in Latin America
Military coup led by General Augusto Pinochet overthrows Allende
New constitution approved under Pinochet's regime
National plebiscite rejects continued rule of Pinochet
Return to democracy with Patricio Aylwin as president
Michelle Bachelet becomes Chile’s first female president
Sebastián Piñera becomes president; Chile hit by massive earthquake
Massive protests spark movement for constitutional change
Gabriel Boric elected as Chile's youngest president
